items.title: Finnish quantum unicorn IQM set to go public
items.summary: Finnish unicorn IQM plans to go public via a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) valuing the company at approximately $1.8 billion — joining the growing cohort of quantum computing companies listed on U.S. stock markets.

items.title: Rob Jetten becomes Netherlands' youngest ever PM
items.summary: The 38-year-old is sworn in as premier after clinching a narrow victory in October's election.

items.summary:
Anthropic:
Anthropic details the AI Fluency Index, tracking 11 behaviors that represent human-AI collaboration and measure how people collaborate with AI  —  People are integrating AI tools into their daily routines at a pace that would have been difficult to predict even a year ago.

items.title: Hungary blocks Russia sanctions, EU cash for Kyiv on eve of Ukraine war anniversary
items.summary: BRUSSELS, Feb 23 (Reuters) - Hungary maintained its veto on Monday ⁠on new EU sanctions on Russia and a huge loan for Ukraine, while a Ukrainian strike on a Russian pumping station serving the Druzhba oil pipeline threatened to further harm Kyiv's fraught ties ⁠with Budapest. Read full story

items.title: Discord distances itself from Persona age verification after user backlash
items.summary: Discord is attempting to distance itself from the age verification provider Persona following a steady stream of user backlash. In an emailed statement to The Verge, Discord's head of product policy, Savannah Badalich, confirms the company "ran a limited test of Persona in the UK where age assurance had previously launched and that test has […]

items.title: Kohler’s new shower reuses dirty water to get you clean
items.summary: Kohler claims its new Anthem EvoCycle smart shower system can deliver "up to 80% water savings" without the use of showerheads that limit flow or pressure. The system instead relies on a reservoir in the shower's base that collects used water and passes it through a filtration system before sending it back up through the […]

items.title: EU's Kallas says will propose to lift sanctions on Venezuela's Delcy Rodriguez
items.summary: BRUSSELS, Feb ⁠23 (Reuters) - European Union's foreign ⁠policy chief Kaja Kallas ‌said on Monday that she will propose that the bloc lifts ​sanctions on Venezuela's ⁠interim president, ⁠Delcy Rodriguez, after lawmakers in the ⁠South ‌American country last week approved a ⁠limited amnesty bill for certain ​prisoners. Read full story

items.title: VPN flaws allowed Chinese hackers to compromise dozens of Ivanti customers, says report
items.summary: Chinese hackers allegedly broke into the network of an Ivanti subsidiary in 2021. The hackers exploited a backdoor in its VPN product, which allowed the hackers to gain access to 119 other unnamed organizations.

items.title: Analysis-Power drought tips Ukraine's economy into worst crisis since war's first year
items.summary: KYIV, Feb 23 (Reuters) - Ukraine's economy is enduring its toughest period ⁠since the early months of Russia's invasion after sustained air strikes left its power system in tatters as the war enters a fifth year, forcing firms to cut output and shrinking state revenues. Read full story

items.title: Iranian students protest for third day as US pressure mounts
items.summary: DUBAI, Feb 23 (Reuters) - ⁠Iranian students defied authorities with protests for a third day on Monday, ⁠weeks after security forces crushed mass unrest with thousands killed and as the ‌United States weighs possible air strikes against the Islamic Republic. Read full story

items.title: If Big Tech cared about fighting AI slop, it wouldn’t be drowning us in it
items.summary: As 2025 drew to a close, Instagram head Adam Mosseri ended the year by doom-posting about AI. "Authenticity is becoming infinitely reproducible," Mosseri lamented. "Everything that made creators matter - the ability to be real, to connect, to have a voice that couldn't be faked - is now accessible to anyone with the right tools." […]

items.title: Sony’s PlayStation VR2 headset hits one of its lowest prices ever today at $299
items.summary:
As part of Amazon’s PlayStation sale, you can now score Sony’s PS VR2 headset for $299 shipped. This is originally a $549 headset that dropped to $400 last year, where it’s mostly stayed since. This headset doesn’t get discounted often outside of big events like Prime Day or Black Friday, so this is a pretty solid deal. You’re looking at a straight-up $101 discount from its usual $400 price. The only time it went lower was a brief dip to $280 that very few were able to grab, and today’s price lands it within just $20 of that all-time low. Today’s discount, which is also matched at Best Buy, marks one of the lowest prices we have tracked for this model, so be sure to snag it after getting more details below.

more…

items.title: MCMC: SMS Scams Becomes Harder To Combat With Rise Of Fake BTS Use
items.summary:

Deputy Communications Minister Teo Nie Ching explained that these devices allow […]
